God of WisdomUpdated on 20 Aug 2019Do bear in mind that if you commit to a short term endowment plan, you absolutely cannot surrender it until the the policy matures, or you will lose money. 3 or 5 years, while not extremely long, is still a period whether you will have no access to this money, and hence you need to consider if you will have enough emergency funds to meet your needs during this period. I'd personally opt for the 3 year one to give myself more flexibility, unless I absolutely can live with not having access to the money for 5 years.2 comments6
